sentences.english: As always, presidential unilateralism puts Congress in a tough position.
sentences.chinese: 總統的單方面決定總是置國會與難堪的境地。

sentences.english: The gredinedst source of misery and hwithred in this world is clinging to past hurts.
sentences.chinese: 這個世界上難堪與仇恨最大源泉是對疇前的執迷。

sentences.english: A very painful surmise arose concerning her character.
sentences.chinese: 對她的人格產生了一種令人難堪的猜度。

sentences.english: He tried to evade the embarrassing question.
sentences.chinese: 他企圖迴避這令人難堪的問題。

sentences.english: Per haps she feels embarrassed to used white gauze cloak to live then half face.
sentences.chinese: 也許她覺得難堪於是便用白紗遮掩住了一半臉。

sentences.english: Her rejection dashed and humiliated him.
sentences.chinese: 她的拒絕使他難堪和丟臉。

sentences.english: 'Don't embarrass your employee or make him feel small, ' says Mr. Das.
sentences.chinese: 達斯說，不要讓員工感到難堪，或讓他覺得無地自容。

sentences.english: He is being hit by a serious of embarrassing rebuffs.
sentences.chinese: 他正遭受一系列令他難堪的冷遇。

sentences.english: Her husband's drunken behavior embarrassed her.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫醉後的舉止使她難堪。

sentences.english: That sits awkwardly with Mr Geithner’s hopes for global rebalancing.
sentences.chinese: 這就使蓋特納對全球再平衡的希冀略嫌難堪了。

sentences.english: That's the blunder. That's the pratfall.
sentences.chinese: 這就是失態環節，讓人難堪。

sentences.english: I don't think anything can be as embarrassing as Daddy Bush puking.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲還有什麼比布什爸爸嘔吐更難堪的了。

sentences.english: Obama might have sensed from the outset it would not be a grueling exercise.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬也許打從開始就覺察出這次訪談不至於太難堪。

sentences.english: The northern state of Bihar used to be even more of an embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 過去，北部比哈爾邦是更加讓人難堪的地方。

sentences.english: Blue Joe lightly coughed a voice again, don't want that seeing plum is handsome entangled.
sentences.chinese: 藍喬又輕輕咳了聲，不想看到李子俊的難堪。

sentences.english: But, as far as Ive known her, everybodys always given her a hard time.
sentences.chinese: 但是，據我所瞭解，現在每個人都在讓她難堪。

definition: have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
